N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.2 - Executive Order No. 2: [Directing Temporary State Commission of Investigation to supervise the investigations into the affairs of the City of New York commenced by the Commission on Governmental Operations of the City of New York.]
State Regulations
TO: THE TEMPORARY STATE COMMISSION OF INVESTIGATION OF THE
STATE OF NEW YORK, 270 Broadway, New York, N.Y.......................................................................................................................... WHEREAS, the Temporary State Commission on Governmental

Operations of the City of New York, created pursuant to chapter 368 of the Laws
of 1959, was at the time of its creation assigned the broad duty of making a
study of governmental operations of the City of New York and of making
recommendations for achieving increased economy, efficiency and effectiveness
in the management of the affairs of the City of New York, in the discharge of
which duty the Commission has been intensively engaged for a period of months; and
WHEREAS, the statute creating the Commission on

Governmental Operations of the City of New York was recently amended pursuant
to chapter 1030 of the Laws of 1960 for the purpose of placing primary emphasis
in its work on revision of the Charter of the City of New York, with the result
that the Commission has now become the principal governmental agency concerned
with Charter revision, a responsibility requiring concentration of the

Commission's time and resources on the work of Charter revision and the
procedures for adoption of Charter changes; and
WHEREAS, its has been concluded that the investigatory work
of the Commission on Governmental Operations of the City of New York should be
pursued under direction separate from that Commission; NOW, THEREFORE, in accordance with and pursuant to the
provisions of Chapter 989 of the Laws of 1958, I hereby direct the Temporary

State Commission of Investigation of the State of New York henceforth to
supervise the investigations into the affairs of the City of New York commenced
by the Commission on Governmental Operations of the City of New York and to
exercise in connection with such investigations all of the powers provided for
in Chapter 989 of the Laws of 1958, for the purpose of studying: the faithful
execution and effective enforcement of the laws of the State; the conduct of
public officers and public employees, and of officers and employees of public
corporations and authorities; and any matter concerning the public peace, public safety and public justice; and, wherever warranted, to assist me in the
discharge of my responsibilities in respect of the matters set forth in Section
2 of Chapter 989 of the Laws of 1958. Signed: Nelson A. Rockefeller

Dated: May 5, 1960
